label: Letter from Sidney Jennings Legendre, August 9, 1947
description: Letter from Sidney Legendre to his brother, Armant Legendre, regarding an upcoming trip Sidney and Morris are making to New Orleans.

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: Letter from Sidney Legendre to his brother, Armant Legendre, regarding an upcoming trip Sidney and Morris are making to New Orleans.

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
August 9, 1947
Dear Armant,
Just returned from a theatre trip and a visit to
the plantation to find your letter of August 2nd.
Certainly an sorry to hear that you are feeling so
badly and do hope that this matter will clear up soon. However
Morris and I do not expect to play tennis and golf when we
arrive. We will devote ourselves entirely to pleasure which
unfortunately now consists entirely of boasting of what we would
like to do. I don't see why you could not join with us in this
relatively simple pastime.
The starting of your firm is very fine and I an
delighted that everything is going so well and certainly hope
it will continue. I do not see why it will not because everyone
likes to do business with you and they have to have coffee, I
could do with a big black cup right now.
I would very mush like to send Katherine to Newcomb
for her first year. Providing that you will not tell her that
I an doing it. Just let me send you a check for the amount and
you take care of the payment. Then by next year when you are
making beaucoup money you can do it without any trouble, but right
this year it maybe a bit of a drag with the new business. I wish
you would let me do this as it would give me great pleasure,and
what difference does it make where the money comes from as long as
our children are benefitted.
So long, Morris and I thought of dragging you up here
for the party but we figured that you would be happier in the peace
of an empty house in New Orleans with a bottle and perhaps an
ocassional female visitor, so we let the matter drop.
